list.title: Document
list.description: Creates a new document.

list.title: Document#description
list.description: The description of the document.

list.title: Document#id
list.description: The ID of the document.

list.title: Document#publicationDate
list.description: The publication data, in an ISO 8601 format.

list.title: Document#refDate
list.description: The reference data, in an ISO 8601 format.

list.title: Document#rightsHolder
list.description: The holder of the rights for the document.

list.title: Document#source
list.description: The source of the document.

list.title: Document#title
list.description: The title of the document.

list.title: Document#user_id
list.description: The creator id.

list.title: Document#validationStatus
list.description: The validation status information.

list.title: Document#visualization
list.description: Visualization information.

list.title: DocumentCommentsModule
list.description: Creates the document comments module. Creates a service and a comments window.

list.title: DocumentCommentsService
list.description: Creates a document comments service.

list.title: DocumentCommentsService#getComments
list.description: Get the comments as JSON object

list.title: DocumentCommentsService#publishComment
list.description: Publish the comments

list.title: DocumentCommentsWindow
list.description: Creates a document comments window to add in the document browser.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow
list.description: Creates a new document creation window.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#_enterEditMode
list.description: Change the controls settings to 'edit mode', ie. the camera moves, zooms and rotates slower. This allows the user to place a document with more accuracy.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#_exitEditMode
list.description: Resets the controls settings to their default value.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#_registerPositionAndQuaternion
list.description: Registers the camera position and orientation.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#accurateControlsSettings
list.description: The settings for an accurate movement of the camera. These settings should be used in the PlanarControls class.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#cameraPosition
list.description: The registered camera position for the document visualization.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#cameraQuaternion
list.description: The registered camera orientation for the document visualization.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#contributeService
list.description: The contribute service to perform requests.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#controls
list.description: The camera controls

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#documentVisualizer
list.description: The document image orienter module.

list.title: DocumentCreationWindow#savedControlsSettings
list.description: The saved state of the planar controls settings. This is used to restore the default settings when needed.

list.title: DocumentFilter
list.description: Constructs a new document filter, from an acceptation function.

list.title: DocumentFilter#accepts
list.description: The function responsible to filter the documents. It must evaluate wether a document is acceptable according to the filter.

list.title: DocumentFilter#apply
list.description: Applies the filter to the documents.

list.title: DocumentInspectorWindow
list.description: Constructs a documents inspector window.

list.title: DocumentInspectorWindow#_fillFieldsFromDocument
list.description: Updates the HTML fields so that they describe the new displayed document.

list.title: DocumentInspectorWindow#_setDefaultFieldValues
list.description: Sets the default values for the HTML fields.

list.title: DocumentInspectorWindow#onDisplayedDocumentChange
list.description: Triggered when the displayed document change. Updates the HTML fields.

list.title: DocumentModule
list.description: Creates a new documents module.

list.title: DocumentModule#addEventListener
list.description:
Adds an event listener to the document provider. There are two types of events :

  • DocumentModule.EVENT_FILTERED_DOCUMENTS_UPDATED fires when the list of filtered documents changes
  • DocumentModule.EVENT_DISPLAYED_DOC_CHANGED fires when the displayed document changes.

list.title: DocumentModule#addFilter
list.description: Adds a filter to the filtering pipeline.

list.title: DocumentModule#changeDocumentSource
list.description: Changes the document source (the object representing the server URLs to fetch the documents).

list.title: DocumentModule#provider
list.description: The document provider filters the list of documents.

list.title: DocumentModule#refreshDocumentList
list.description: Updates the filtered documents list by fetching them from the DocumentService and applying the successive filters. Triggers the DOCUMENT_LIST_UPDATED and then the DISPLAYED_DOCUMENT_CHANGED events.

list.title: DocumentModule#removeEventListener
list.description: Removes an event listener from the document provider.

list.title: DocumentModule#service
list.description: The document service holds the list of documents fetched from the server.

list.title: DocumentModule#view
list.description: The document view represents the user interface for the documents.

list.title: DocumentNavigatorWindow#clear
list.description: Clears the research fields.

list.title: DocumentNavigatorWindow#search
list.description: Event on the 'search' button click.

list.title: DocumentNavigatorWindow#searchFilter
list.description: The filter corresponding to the research fields.

list.title: DocumentProvider
list.description: Constructs a new documents provider.

list.title: DocumentProvider#addFilter
list.description: Adds a filter to the filtering pipeline.

list.title: DocumentProvider#allDocuments
list.description: The list of all documents.

list.title: DocumentProvider#displayedDocumentIndex
list.description: The currently displayed document.

list.title: DocumentProvider#filteredDocuments
list.description: The list of filtered documents.

list.title: DocumentProvider#filters
list.description: The list of filters.

list.title: DocumentProvider#getAllDocuments
list.description: Returns the list of all documents.

list.title: DocumentProvider#getDisplayedDocument
list.description: Returns the currently displayed document.

list.title: DocumentProvider#getDisplayedDocumentImage
list.description: Returns the image corresponding to the displayed document. It is a string that can be put into the src attribute of an img tag (so either an URL or a base64 encoded file).

list.title: DocumentProvider#getDisplayedDocumentIndex
list.description: Returns the displayed document index.

list.title: DocumentProvider#getFilteredDocuments
list.description: Returns the filtered list of documents.

list.title: DocumentProvider#refreshDocumentList
list.description: Updates the filtered documents list by fetching them from the DocumentService and applying the successive filters. Triggers the DOCUMENT_LIST_UPDATED and then the DISPLAYED_DOCUMENT_CHANGED events.

list.title: DocumentProvider#service
list.description: The document service.

list.title: DocumentProvider#setDisplayedDocument
list.description: Sets the given document as the displayed one.

list.title: DocumentProvider#setDisplayedDocumentIndex
list.description: Change the displayed document index. Sends a DISPLAYED_DOCUMENT_CHANGED event.

list.title: DocumentProvider#shiftDisplayedDocumentIndex
list.description: Shift the displayed document index. The filtered array is treated as cyclical. Sends a DISPLAYED_DOCUMENT_CHANGED event.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter
list.description: Creates a new document search filter.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#clear
list.description: Clears the filter.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#filterDocument
list.description: The function to filter the documents.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#keywords
list.description: A list of keywords to search in the title or the description of the document. These keywords should be in lowercase.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#pubEndDate
list.description: The upper bound of the publication date.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#pubStartDate
list.description: The lower bound of the publication date.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#refEndDate
list.description: The upper bound of the refering date.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#refStartDate
list.description: The lower bound of the refering date.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#rightsHolder
list.description: The rights holder. Should be in lowercase.

list.title: DocumentSearchFilter#source
list.description: A string representing the source. Should be in lowercase.

list.title: DocumentService#fetchDocumentImage
list.description: Fetches the image corresponding to the given document.

list.description: Fetches the documents from the server and return them in an array.

list.title: DocumentService#source

list.title: DocumentSource#getDocumentUrl
list.description: Returns the URL to retrieve the documents.

list.title: DocumentSource#getImageUrl
list.description: Returns the URL to retrieve the image of the document.

list.title: DocumentUpdateWindow
list.description: Creates a new document update window.

list.title: DocumentUpdateWindow#contributeService
list.description: The contribute service to perform requests.

list.title: DocumentValidationModule
list.description: Creates the document validation module. Creates a validation service to manage HTTP requests, a validation source to change the retrieving URL and finally the view elements.

list.title: DocumentView
list.description: Creates a document view.

list.title: DocumentView#inspectorWindow
list.description: The inspector window.

list.title: DocumentView#navigatorWindow

list.title: DocumentView#provider

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow
list.description: Creates a new document image orienter.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#itownsView
list.description: The iTowns view.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#position
list.description: The visualization camera position.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#quaternion
list.description: The visualization camera orientation.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#setImageSrc
list.description: Sets the image source.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#setTargetPosition
list.description: Sets the orientation for the camera. startTravel should be called after this method to apply the new position.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#setTargetQuaternion
list.description: Sets the orientation for the camera. startTravel should be called after this method to apply the new orientation.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#startTravel
list.description: Starts the document orientation. The processes first assign the correct src to the image, then sets the opacity to 0. After the travel is finished, the opacity is gradually restored. To call this function, the position, quaternion and imageSrc attributes must all have been set beforehand.

list.title: DocumentVisualizerWindow#startTravelToDisplayedDocument
list.description: Retrieve the displayed document and start a travel to its visualization location.

list.title: DocumentsInValidationDocumentSource
list.description: Creates the document source.

list.title: DocumentsInValidationDocumentSource#getDocumentUrl
list.description: Returns the URL of the document to validate

list.title: DocumentsInValidationDocumentSource#getImageUrl
list.description: Returns the URL of the image of the document

list.description: Drag and drop ui element in city to pass in avatar mode

list.description: camera manager

list.title: DragAndDropAvatar#itownsCameraQuaternion
list.description: record where was camera quaternion

list.title: DragAndDropAvatar#setAvatar
list.description: Update state of this based on there is an avatar or not

list.description: It computes the elevation of the avatar and sends it to the game context

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#ExternalScriptBase
list.description: Skeleton of a game context script, different {@link Context.EVENT} are trigger by {@link Context}

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#context
list.description: context of this script

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#dispose
list.description: call when frame3D is disposed

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#init
list.description: call after an object3D has been added to context

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#object3D
list.description: object3D attach to this script@type {Game.Object3D}

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#onComponentUpdate
list.description: call when an external script onOutdated return true

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#onGameObjectRemoved
list.description: call when a gameobject3D have been removed from context

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#onNewGameObject
list.description: call when a new gameobject3D have been added to context

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#onOutdated
list.description: call every time your game object3D model has changed

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#onRemove
list.description: call when this gameobject 3D is removed from context

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#onResize
list.description: call when frame3D is resized

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#tick
list.description: call every step

list.title: ExternalScriptBase#variables
list.description: custom variables attach to this script

list.title: Frame3DBase
list.description: Basic Frame3D wrap different html element to handle CSS3D rendering {@link CSS3DRenderer}. It's possible to add {@link Billboard} to this. Composed with {@link THREE.Scene} + {@link THREE.PerspectiveCamera} + {@link THREE.WebGLRenderer}.

list.description: current billboards in frame3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#camera
list.description: camera 3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#css3DRenderer
list.description: css renderer

list.title: Frame3DBase#css3DScene
list.description: css scene

list.title: Frame3DBase#dispose
list.description: Remove html from the DOM and stop listeners

list.title: Frame3DBase#initCSS3D
list.description: Init the css3D renderer

list.title: Frame3DBase#isRendering
list.description: flag to stop rendering 3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#listeners
list.description: listeners of {@link Frame3DBase.EVENT}

list.title: Frame3DBase#on
list.description: Register a listener on a {@link Frame3DBase.EVENT}

list.title: Frame3DBase#onResize
list.description: Resize frame3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#render
list.description: Render scene3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#renderCSS3D
list.description: Render css3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#renderer
list.description: canvas renderer

list.title: Frame3DBase#resizeListener
list.description: reference resize listener to remove it on dispose

list.description: root css (where css3Delement are added)

list.title: Frame3DBase#rootHtml
list.description: root html

list.title: Frame3DBase#rootWebGL
list.description: root webgl (where canvas is added)

list.title: Frame3DBase#scene
list.description: canvas scene 3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#setDisplaySize
list.description: Resize with css html element

list.title: Frame3DBase#setRender
list.description: Customize how to render the frame3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#size
list.description: Size of the frame3D

list.title: Frame3DBase#ui
list.description: where ui element should be added (note that you have to handle manually z-index element composing ui, should it be automatically ?)

list.title: Frame3DBase#updateSize
list.description: update this.size

list.title: Frame3DBase.EVENT
list.description: Events triggered by {@link Frame3DBase}

list.title: Frame3DPlanar#dispose
list.description: Dispose Frame3D

list.title: Frame3DPlanar#enableItownsViewRendering
list.description: Disable/enable itowns rendering from itowns.mainLoop

list.title: Frame3DPlanar#onResize

list.title: GeocodingService#GeocodingService
list.description: Instantiates the geocoding service.

list.title: GeocodingService#getCoordinates
list.description: Retrieves the coordinates based on the search string parameter.

list.title: GeocodingView#GeocodingView
list.description: Instantiates the view.

list.title: GeocodingView#addMeshToScene
list.description: Places the given mesh into the scene, orienting it towards the bottom.

list.title: GeocodingView#addPin
list.description: Adds a pin to the scene. A pin is made of two meshes : a sphere and a cylinder.

list.title: GeocodingView#displayError
list.description: Displays an error info box under the search bar.

list.title: GeocodingView#dispose
list.description: Dispose the view.

list.title: GeocodingView#doGeocoding
list.description: Removes places pins, then makes a new search geocoding query. If at least one result is found, places pins at appropriate places and focuses the camera on the first result.

list.title: GeocodingView#getWorldCoordinates
list.description: Converts a lat/long position into world coordinates, usable in the scene.

list.title: GeocodingView#removePins
list.description: Remove all pins from the scene.

list.title: Graph#Graph
list.description: Create a new D3 graph from an RDF JSON object. Adapted from https://observablehq.com/@d3/force-directed-graph#chart and https://www.d3indepth.com/zoom-and-pan/

list.title: Graph#canvas
list.description: Getter for retrieving the d3 svg.

list.title: Graph#clear
list.description: Remove nodes and lines from the SVG.

list.title: Graph#drag
list.description: Create a drag effect for graph nodes within the context of a force simulation

list.title: Graph#formatResponseData
list.description: return a SPARQL endpoint query response formatted for a D3.js graph.

list.title: Graph#getNodeColorId
list.description: Get the id (or index) of a uri from the typeList. Each type in the type list is used to color nodes in the graph. If the uri does not exist in the typeList, add the uri.

list.title: Graph#handleZoom
list.description: A handler function for selecting elements to transform during a zoom event

list.title: Graph#hide
list.description: Hide the graph SVG

list.title: Graph#show
list.description: Show the graph SVG

list.title: Graph#update
list.description: Create a new graph based on an graph dataset.

list.title: GuidedTour#exitGuidedTour
list.description: Quit current guided tour

list.title: GuidedTour#initializeButtons
list.description: Event listeners (buttons)

list.title: GuidedTour#nextStep
list.description: Update step by clicking on "guidedTourNextStepButton" button

list.title: GuidedTour#nextTour
list.description: Update guided tour preview by clicking on "guidedTourNextTourButton" button

list.title: GuidedTour#previewTour
list.description: Initialize the preview of the guided tour

list.title: GuidedTour#previousStep
list.description: Update step by clicking on "guidedTourPreviousStepButton" button

list.title: GuidedTour#previousTour
list.description: Update guided tour preview by clicking on "guidedTourPreviousTourButton" button

list.title: GuidedTour#startGuidedTour
list.description: Start guided tour

list.title: GuidedTour#startGuidedTourMode
list.description: Get all available guided tour from the database

list.title: GuidedTour#toggleGuidedTourWindow
list.description: Hide or show the guided tour window

list.title: GuidedTour#updateStep
list.description: Update step with current step data

list.title: GuidedTourController
list.description: Constructor for GuidedTourController The controller reads data from a database to build one or more guided tours Each guided tour is a succession of "steps" Each step has a document + tour text + doc text (steps are instances of the TourStep class) Multiple guided tours are supported (only one tour is finished for the demo) For the demo : options.preventUserFromChangingTour allows to hide the buttons for changing tour

list.title: GuidedTourController#getCurrentStep
list.description: Returns the current tour step

list.title: GuidedTourController#getCurrentTour
list.description: Returns the current guided tour if there are any

list.title: GuidedTourController#getGuidedTours
list.description: Get all guided tour from a database

list.title: GuidedTourController#getNextStep
list.description: Sets the current step to the next step and returns it.

list.title: GuidedTourController#getNextTour
list.description: Sets the current guided tour to the next guided tour and returns it.

list.title: GuidedTourController#getPreviousStep
list.description: Sets the current step to the previous step and returns it.

list.title: GuidedTourController#getPreviousTour
list.description: Sets the current guided tour to the previous guided tour and returns it.

list.title: GuidedTourController#reset
list.description: Reset browser at the begining of the guided tours

list.title: InputManager
list.description: Manage user inputs with a poll system (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polling_(computer_science))

list.title: InputManager#addKeyCommand
list.description: Add a command for severals keys

list.title: InputManager#addKeyInput
list.description: Register a callback for a particular key and event

list.title: InputManager#addMouseCommand
list.description: Add a command for mouse

list.title: InputManager#addMouseInput
list.description: Register a callback for a particular mouse event

list.title: InputManager#commandsBuffer
list.description: avoid a command to be computed two times if multiple keys are attach to it

list.title: InputManager#computeCommands
list.description: Compute Commands with the last state stored of keys and mouse

list.title: InputManager#controlSensitivity
list.description: Converts a key to lowercase if case sensitivity is not required.

list.title: InputManager#dispose
list.description: Remove listeners and reset variables

list.title: InputManager#element
list.description: element catching mouse event

list.title: InputManager#initPointerLock
list.description: Initialize pointer lock management On keypress keyup and click event try to request pointer lock on this.element if this.pointerLock is true

list.title: InputManager#isCaseSensitive
list.description: true so that the inputs are case sensitive

list.title: InputManager#isPressed
list.description: Return true if the key is pressed, dont forget to listenKeys if no addKeyCommand has been used for this key

list.title: InputManager#keyCommands
list.description: register a callback associated to a key event

list.title: InputManager#keyMap
list.description: register if a key is pressed or not

list.title: InputManager#keyMapKeyDown
list.description: register if a key state is down

list.title: InputManager#keyMapKeyUp
list.description: register if a key state is up

list.title: InputManager#listenKeys
list.description: Used this if a key has not been register in addKeyCommand and you need to know if it's isPressed

list.title: InputManager#listeners
list.description: register listeners to dispose them

list.title: InputManager#mouseCommands
list.description: register callback associated to an event + command id

list.title: InputManager#mouseState
list.description: store state of the mouse

list.title: InputManager#pause
list.description: if true {@link EventCallback} and {@link CommandCallback} are not called

list.title: InputManager#removeInputListener
list.description: Remove event listener with the callback used to register it

list.title: InputManager#removeKeyCommand
list.description: Dispose a command associated to keys

list.title: InputManager#setPointerLock
list.description: If value is true pointerLock mode is activated else it's exited

list.title: InputManager#startListening
list.description: Start listening

list.title: KEY
list.description: Some unique key to not collide with another item recorded in localStorage

list.description: Create the description part of ColorLayers

list.description: Create the description part of GeometryLayers

list.title: LoadingView#updateProgress
list.description: Updates the progress bar of a loading bar with the given id. Sets the width of the loading bar with the given percent.

list.title: MAPPING
list.description: Default mapping of controller

list.title: MOUSE_STATE_EVENTS
list.description: List of mouse event handle by MouseState

list.title: MouseState
list.description: Poll system (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polling_(computer_science)) Listen to the MOUSE_STATE_EVENTS and store the mouse state to then be access synchronously

list.title: MouseState#addEvent
list.description: Add a listener for a particular event on element

list.title: MouseState#dispose
list.description: Remove listeners and reset variables

list.title: MouseState#dragging
list.description: true if the mouse is dragging

list.title: MouseState#event
list.description: Access the last Event stored for eventID

list.title: MouseState#isTrigger
list.description: Return true if this event has been triggered on the last poll

list.title: MouseState#listeners
list.description: register all listeners to well dispose them on dipose

list.title: MouseState#mouseEvent
list.description: register event native js to pass it later synchronously

list.title: MouseState#mouseMap
list.description: register if a mouse event is trigger or not

list.title: MouseState#reset
list.description: Reset Event triggered

list.title: MouseState#startListening
list.description: Start listening {@link MOUSE_STATE_EVENTS} on the element

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow
list.description: Creates a SPARQL query window.

list.description: Clear the DataView of content.

list.description: Contains the D3 graph view to display RDF data.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#jsonRenderer
list.description: A reference to the JsonRenderer class

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#queries
list.description: Store the queries of the SparqlQueryWindow from the config.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#sparqlProvider
list.description: The SPARQL Endpoint Response Provider

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#table
list.description: Contains the D3 table to display RDF data.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateDataView
list.description: Update the DataView.

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateQueryDropdown
list.description: Update this.querySelect options using an array of queries. For each element in the array, create an option element, set the innerHTML of the option to the query's title, set the value of the option to the index of the query in the array, then append the option to this.querySelect

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateQueryTextArea
list.description: Update the this.queryTextArea with the text of the query that was selected in the dropdown

list.title: SparqlQueryWindow#updateResultDropdown
list.description: Remove all the children of this.resultSelect, then adds new children options based on the formats declared in each query configuration from from this.queries

list.description: Update the table with new data.

list.title: Target
list.description: Buffer object which store all data to keep following an object3D target

list.title: ValidationService
list.description: Constructs a validation service.

list.title: ValidationService#validate
list.description: Sends the request to validate the document.

list.title: ValidationView
list.description: Creates the view.

list.title: ValidationView#displayingDocumentsToValidate
list.description: Defines wether the interface displays documents to validate (true) or validated documents (false).

list.title: ValidationView#previousDocumentSource
list.description: Stores the previous document source to restore it (the source for validated documents).

list.title: ValidationView#validationSource
list.description: The validation source.

list.title: Window#Window
list.description: Creates a window.

list.title: Window#addExtension
list.description: Adds a new extension in the window.

list.title: Window#appendTo
list.description: Creates the HTML elements of the window and add them to the given parent node. Calls the windowCreated hook method and sends two events, EVENT_CREATED and EVENT_SHOWN.

list.title: Window#contentIsVisible
list.description: If the content's display property is not equal to none, then return true, otherwise return false.

list.title: Window#defaultStyle
list.description: Defines if the window has its default style. If set to false, you should override the html getter and set the windowDisplayWhenVisible property.

list.title: Window#destroy
list.description: Destroys the window. Calls the windowDestroyed hook method and sends an EVENT_DESTROYED event.

list.title: Window#disableView
list.description: If hideOnClose is true, hides the window. Else, destroys it.

list.title: Window#enableView
list.description: Creates and show the window.

list.title: Window#hide
list.description: Hides the window. Sends an EVENT_HIDDEN event.

list.title: Window#hideOnClose
list.description: Behaviour of the window when the 'close' button is hit. If set to true, the window will hide. If set to false, the window will destroy.

list.title: Window#innerContentHtml
list.description: HTML string representing the inner content of the window.

list.title: Window#isExtensionUsed
list.description: Removes an existing extension from the window.

list.title: Window#name
list.description: Name of the window. Used to generate unique ids.

list.title: Window#removeExtension
list.description: Removes an existing extension from the window.

list.title: Window#show
list.description: Shows the window. Sends an EVENT_SHOWN event.

list.title: Window#title
list.description: Title displayed on the window.

list.title: Window#toggleContentVisibility
list.description: If the content is not visible, make it visible, otherwise make it invisible

list.title: Window#windowCreated
list.description: Method called when the window is created. During and after the call, all HTML properties are not null.

list.title: Window#windowDestroyed
list.description: Method called when the window is destroyed.

list.title: Window#windowDisplayWhenVisible
list.description: Define the css display property when the window is visible.

list.title: Window#windowExtensions
list.description: The list of extensions for this window.

list.title: WindowExtension
list.description: Create a new Window extension object.

list.title: WindowExtension#appendTo
list.description: Adds the extension in the given HTML node.

list.title: WindowExtension#callback
list.description: The callback to call when the user clicks on a button extension. This has no effects on div extensions.

list.title: WindowExtension#container
list.description: The label of the parent container.

list.title: WindowExtension#findContainer
list.description: Searches for a HTML node that can contains the extension.

list.title: WindowExtension#html
list.description: The inner HTML content for the extension. If this is a button, it represents the displayed text. If this is a div, it represents the inner HTML content.

list.title: WindowExtension#id
list.description: The ID of the root HTML element.

list.title: WindowExtension#label
list.description: The unique label for the extension.

list.title: WindowExtension#oncreated
list.description: A callback triggered when the HTML elements of the extension is effectively created.

list.title: WindowExtension#type
list.description: The type of the extension. Can either be button or div.

list.title: WindowManager#registerWindow
list.description: Registers a window.

list.title: add3DTilesLayers
list.description: Setup and add 3D tiles to an itowns view

list.title: addBaseMapLayer
list.description: Add Base map layer to an itowns view

list.title: addElevationLayer
list.description: Add Elevation map layer to an itowns view

list.title: addGeoJsonLayers
list.description: Sets up a GeoJson layers and adds them to the itowns view (for the demos that don't need more granularity than that).

list.title: addGeoJsonLayers~setupAndAddGeoJsonLayer
list.description: Create an iTowns GeoJson layer based on the specified layerConfig.

list.title: addLabelLayers
list.description: Sets up LabelLayers and adds them to the itowns view. The source of a LabelLayer can be either a WFS source or a File source. The features in the source must be Point geometries.

list.title: addLabelLayers~setupAndAddLabelLayer
list.description: Create an iTowns LabelLayer based on the specified layerConfig.

list.title: addLights
list.description: Add default lights to a scene 3D one directional and one ambient

list.title: appendWireframeByGeometryAttributeToObject3D
list.description: Traverse a THREE.Object3D and append in each Object3D children a THREE.LineSegment geometry representing its wireframe. Each wireframe geometry will keep the associated attribute value.

list.title: appendWireframeToObject3D
list.description: Traverse a THREE.Object3D and append in each Object3D children a THREE.LineSegment geometry representing its wireframe

list.title: bindLightTransform
list.description: Place the directional light in order its shadow camera fit the object

list.title: cameraFitRectangle
list.description: Move camera transform so the rectangle define by min & max (in the xy plane) fit the entire screen

list.title: checkParentChild
list.description: Check if an html element belong to another one recursively

list.title: computeNearFarCamera
list.description: Compute near and far of camera in order to wrap a box define by a min and max value

list.title: computeRelativeElevationFromGround
list.description: Compute relative elevation from ground of a Object3D

list.title: createC3DTilesLayer
list.description: It creates a 3D Tiles layer, and adds it to the layer manager

list.title: createDisplayable
list.description: Create a button to toggle visibility of the content in a container

list.title: defaultConfigScene
list.description: Default scene 3D config

list.title: focusC3DTilesLayer
list.description: Focus a C3DTiles Layer

list.title: focusCameraOn
list.description: Makes the camera move to focus on the target position.

list.description: Initialize the webgl renderer with default values

list.title: initScene
list.description: Init scene 3D with {@link SceneConfig}

list.title: localStorageSetCameraMatrix
list.description: If there was a camera matrix recorded in localStorage restore it matrix world + when tab is closing record current camera matrix world /!\ calling this function make window reference the camera avoiding it to be GC and could cause memory leak You want to use this only when there is just one camera during the lifecycle of your application
